revision.text: ==English== ===Etymology=== From {{affix|en|year|-s-|-worth}}. ===Noun=== {{en-noun|-}} # The amount of something that is expected to last for or be produced in one year. #* '''1967''', ''Water and Water Engineering'' #*: We've given a million pounds to these waterworks and we shan't live to use more than (say) fifteen '''yearsworth''' of them. #* '''1994''', Bradford Morrow, ''Conjunctions'', Random House Inc {{ISBN|9780679755814}} #*: So she writes ten '''yearsworth''' of practice-fiction without making noteworthy progress except in language-mechanics and the range of her vocabulary, meanwhile accumulating mileage on her experiential odometer #* '''1997''', John Barth, ''The Tidewater Tales'', Taylor & Francis {{ISBN|9780801855566}}, page 313 #*: He didn't look like my father or my brother, Kath; he was my clone, only older. He didn't look like what I look like now, seventeen '''yearsworth''' of stories later; he looked like what I'll look like another twenty-some '''yearsworth''' of stories from now
